name: Shane Lee
text: Great time got to watch the ceremony of champions Roll Tide Roll....24/7/365

name: Jake Howle
text: Have to register to come in and no mask or coffee shop anymore. Lame

name: Pawan Subedi
text: Great place for me to do my studies. Thankfully they are open during this pandemic thing as well.

name: Zoe Marie
text:
My absolute favorite and ONLY place to study on campus. I can’t be sure exactly what makes me love Gorgas so much, but I always check it’s hours before I commit to having a Study day, because it’s where I can easily focus, get/stay comfortable, and remain for HOURS.
The staff is great, both librarians and Java City employees, (despite what some people may say in the Java City reviews) and it’s got a space for everyone regardless of noise or atmosphere preferences.
I always study in the 1st floor Mac room. It’s a “loud” level, meaning groups meet up and are allowed to talk at full volume. Some people don’t like this, but being able to have my headphones in and not worry about complete silence around me is strangely comforting. Also, I can answer my phone while studying without worrying about bothering anyone too much.
My only complaint is that I wish Gorgas had hours similar to Rodgers. They are already open fairly late, (usually ~ 7am - 2am) but I am always so happy during dead/finals week when they are open 24/7.
Definitely check out Gorgas library if you haven’t already, you will not be disappointed!

name: Lee Myatt-Campbell
text: Love this place, the library..Yes u can order pizza at 4

name: shay-shay t
text: Beverages are way too sweet to even enjoy. I couldn't even taste the coffee. I payed way to much for a drink only a child would enjoy.

name: ZIWEI CHEN
text: I love this place. The style of architecture is very vintage.

name: Jacob Williamson
text: Plenty of space to study and you can get pizza delivered at 2 am.

name: Boris Penkov
text: Great.

name: Windy Glasgow
text: RIP all of you lost in the crash. Thank you for this contribution!

name: Alex Lee
text: Love this library

name: Eunice Paige
text:
Oakwood Library is a BLESSING to have in our community. Although I am not a student; they allow non-students to use their library at no cost. I go there mostly to use the computers.
#WHATABLESSING

name: Grayson Mejia (グレイソンメヒア)
text: Terrible place to study, especially in the evening after 7 pm. There's always too much noise! On top of that, the staff don't care. If you want a quiet place to study, you're better off going somewhere else.

name: Oree Tanking
text: There's always noise here despite it being a library. It's more like a recreational place. If you want to study don't do it here.

name: Ryuu Ishii
text: I enjoy the Salmon library. Its quiet, as a library should be, and has a load of books. It has study spaces for students and computers to use. The floorplan can be tricky at first but after a few trips I can navigate it with ease, and I get lost in my dorm room lol.

name: Barbie Garner
text: Nice library

name: Kiva Karmen
text: As a visitor, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. I was allowed to study in quiet on the second floor. The receptionists  were so helpful by getting me a visitors parking pass.  Visitors be prepared to have your vehicle license number in order to get a one day parking pass in order to use the library. The Charger cafe was conveniently located for a quick snack or some java.

name: Taylor Thomas
text: While the library is nice, the parking is not.

name: brooklyn dodds
text: Although I am not a current student, this library welcomes me. It is easy to get a FREE parking pass and floor 3 is a quiet study area. 👍🏻

name: m fr
text: Some really “Nasty” staff members, but there are great ones too.

name: Numeria Zayas
text: As a visitor I was able to do some research here.

name: Josiah Schlabach
text: Excellent place to find sources for research.

name: Alex Mitchell
text: Terrible library

name: Anna Klouser
text: The school never opens the library on the weekends. They change they open times every week so it’s just a guessing game when you’re actually allowed to study at the library. There is only one study room. It’s more of a student union.

name: Helen H. Gonzalez
text: Nice Library.
